english: star; heavenly body; starlight; small amount

etymology.description: phonetic 晶 + phonetic 生; 晶 later simplified to 日; 晶 originally referred to this word.
etymology.interpretation: A light/glitter element (historically 晶, later written as 日) combines with the phonetic 生 to approximate an early xing-like sound. Early usage had 晶 itself mean ‘twinkling stars’, with 生 added to reinforce the sound before the top component was reduced to 日 in the modern form.

examples.chinese: 夜空中有许多明亮的星星(夜空中有許多明亮的星星)。
examples.pinyin: Yèkōng zhōng yǒu xǔduō míngliàng de xīngxing.
examples.english: There are many bright stars in the night sky.

examples.chinese: 星光照在海面上，像碎银一样(星光照在海面上，像碎銀一樣)。
examples.pinyin: Xīngguāng zhào zài hǎimiàn shang, xiàng suìyín yíyàng.
examples.english: Starlight shines on the sea, like scattered silver.

examples.chinese: 山谷里零星有几户人家，灯火星星点点(山谷裡零星有幾戶人家，燈火星星點點)。
examples.pinyin: Shāngǔ lǐ língxīng yǒu jǐ hù rénjiā, dēnghuǒ xīngxing diǎndiǎn.
examples.english: There are a few scattered households in the valley, with lights twinkling here and there.
